section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਬਾਪਿ ਦਿਲਾਸਾ ਮੇਰੋ ਕੀਨ੍ਹਾ ॥ ਸੇਜ ਸੁਖਾਲੀ ਮੁਖਿ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਦੀਨ੍ਹਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: My Father has comforted me. He has given me a cozy bed, and placed His Ambrosial Nectar in my mouth.

transliteration.text: bāp dilāsā mērō kīnhā . sēj sukhālī mukh anmrit dīnhā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਤਿਸੁ ਬਾਪ ਕਉ ਕਿਉ ਮਨਹੁ ਵਿਸਾਰੀ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: How could I forget that Father from my mind?

transliteration.text: tis bāp kau kiu manah visārī .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When I go to the world hereafter, I shall not lose the game. ||1||

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. text: ਮੁਈ ਮੇਰੀ ਮਾਈ ਹਉ ਖਰਾ ਸੁਖਾਲਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Maya is dead, O mother, and I am very happy.

transliteration.text: muī mērī māī hau kharā sukhālā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਪਹਿਰਉ ਨਹੀ ਦਗਲੀ ਲਗੈ ਨ ਪਾਲਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I do not wear the patched coat, nor do I feel the chill. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: pahirau nahī dagalī lagai n pālā .1. rahāu .

section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I am a sacrifice to my Father, who gave me life.

transliteration.text: bal tis bāpai jin hau jāiā .

translation.text: He put an end to my association with the five deadly sins.

translation.text: I have conquered those five demons, and trampled them underfoot.

section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Remembering the Lord in meditation, my mind and body are drenched with His Love. ||2||

text: ਹਉ ਪੂਤੁ ਤੇਰਾ ਤੂੰ ਬਾਪੁ ਮੇਰਾ ॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I am Your son, and You are my Father.

transliteration.text: hau pūt tērā tūn bāp mērā .

translation.text: Says Kabeer, the Lord's humble servant knows only the One.

text: ਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ਮੈ ਸਭੁ ਕਿਛੁ ਸੂਝਿਆ ॥੪॥੩॥
section: Aasaa - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: By Guru's Grace, I have come to know everything. ||4||3||
